metadata.title: CVE-2015-5276 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
The std::random_device class in libstdc++ in the GNU Compiler Collection(aka GCC) before 4.9.4 does not properly handle short reads from blockingsources, which makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to predictthe random values via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5276` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gcc-snapshot - 20151011-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gcc-arm-none-eabi - 15:6.3.1+svn253039
gcc-arm-none-eabi-source - 15:6.3.1+svn253039
No subscription required

gcc-avr - 1:5.4.0+Amtel3.6.0-1build1
No subscription required

g++-mingw-w64 - 17

criterions.comment: gcc-snapshot package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20151011-0ubuntu1').
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15:6.3.1+svn253039').
gcc-avr package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:5.4.0+Amtel3.6.0-1build1').
gcc-mingw-w64 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17').
gcc-msp430 package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
